reviews.review_msg: Really puts the BIG in big sarge. When I grow up, I wanna be a cop just like him.
kinda hot lowkey
McConnell was an OG street goon back in his days with the VPD, and now I had the pleasure to see the big sarge that he's become. Free my boy McConnell, I lowkey wouldn't mind if he slides in my dms.
They packed his ahh up ðŸ˜­
Professor lost his job because his slid dm's into classmates and made advances that were not professional.
Is currently being investigated for sexual misconduct with his students. Allegation involve grooming, and coercion.
Never looked at my eyes.
Prof is quite disorganized at times. but he makes up for it very well because he is so open and kind towards feedback. TA was also great.

Favourite class of my undergrad and a great way to end my last semester! Dr McConnell was so engaging and somewhat laid-back with lecturing yet they're so informative and makes it exciting to go every week. If I could take another one of his courses, I would do so in a heartbeat.
Weekly readings and posts but graded very fairly and lenient. Great prof, funny lectures that you actually want to be there for. Highly recommend

Dr McConnell is an amazing prof that is very passionate about the courses he teaches! Although a lot of reading, he provides interesting ones and there is no textbook to purchase. I highly recommend taking a class with him if you get the opportunity.

Just so good. if you can take his class just do it. He is responsible for teaching students, lecture is fun, grades fairly, provide instruction for every module, and overall very organized. The weekly module quiz is kinda lengthy and time-consuming but still worth taking his course

Easy assignments, fun to do and still teach you a lot. His lectures are great as his connections to his career as a police officer offer an intriguing perspective you won't see in many profs. Keiron is an effervescent and intelligent prof. His lectures are full of substance but he teaches in a way that actually sticks with you. Take this class!!!!!

Dr. McConnell is my favourite professor so far. He tells funny stories to connect to lecture topics. He's understanding of students course loads so is very easy going with deadlines. Would take again in a heart beat!

Sticky situation. Easy prof,ood lectures, got a good grade, but honestly - ethically prob not okay to be teaching this class. So biased. We paid tuition to have a VPD recruiter take up one of our lectures.

THE BEST. His sense of humour made class on a Friday evening seem not too bad. This class consisted of flipped notes, a paper, tutorial presentations and participation, and a term quiz. All of which were very straightforward and doable. I like that he didn't force us to buy a textbook. His life experiences made this class one of a kind.

BEST class of my undergrad, McConnell makes the class interesting with his stories and experiences working with the VPD, pest prof at SFU and definitely learned the most from this class. If you ever get the chance to take a class with him take the opportunity. Assignments were easy and straightforward

I disagree that Dr. McConnell has an unbiased view on the police. He works with the VPD and is very much pro-police perspective on many issues. I believe it is fine to share his opinions, but he sometimes made ignorant/strange remarks about critical social movements. The course content was very interesting but his personal opinions can be alarming

McConnell is the best prof. This guy had me looking forward to CLASS on a FRIDAY from 2:30 to 4:30. Be prepared to read and do weekly flipped notes (this actually helped A LOT for when the term quiz came around). His stories and unbiased view on policing definitely made this class the best class I have taken throughout my entire undergrad.

McConnell is an awesome professor. He is a great lecturer and provides realistic takes and viewpoints from his research and his years as a VPD officer. Easily the best prof of my entire undergrad. He will literally make the entire lecture hall laugh with his stories. Always willing to help students who are struggling and encourages questions.

I could listen to him talk about crime all day. McConnell has a very unique background from his experience in policing and is able to share a lot of insight on the topics. He is pretty laid back and funny at times, lots of interesting stories. Best prof I've ever had. There is a bit of reading to do but you can get a great grade if you stay on it.
Best professor I've ever had. Easy

Fun and easy, but if youre not a fan of reading, itll be hard. no textbook is required but he has lots of readings per week that needs to be summarized for flipped notes. He needs to get new TAs, the TAs were not responsive to any emails. Sometimes though, I wish he would actually go over all the lecture slides instead of skipping some of them.

Although his exams were pretty straightforward, his grading for the flipped notes (worth 30%) was extremely hard. There was no one in the class who had received a 100% on any of the flipped notes, as I saw from the canvas grade average. That's messed up. Not one single person. Really not fair...

Professor Mcconnell was absolutely amazing. By far my favorite prof at SFU, his lectures are super interesting and he brings in lots of personal experience. Definitely recommend taking this Prof, he sets out clear guidelines for assignments. One of the first classes where I felt like I was actually learning something valuable.

Keiron was a great lecturer, he was constantly telling stories about his time working in the VPD gang unit. These stories really helped identify key components of organized crime. He also had a different more real perspective on crime in comparison to other professors who have never spent time on the streets actually seeing offences happen.

Easily the funniest professor I've ever had. His humour makes his lectures super engaging and I've never heard the entire 200 person class erupt in laughter. Content is super interesting and you can tell he is passionate about his work, sharing plenty of stories from his past. Would absolutely take him again despite him being a somewhat hard marker

Keiron was one of my favourite professor during the Spring semester. He genuinely cares about his class and finds ways to explain or give feedback. It starts rocky but once you get to know him. He genuinely is one of the nicest professor I have taken so far. He is not an easy marker, but I would take another class with him!
